gameComponents

Class CurvedMirror

  • java.lang.Object
    • gameComponents.GameComponent
      • gameComponents.OpticalObject
        • gameComponents.Mirror
          • gameComponents.CurvedMirror
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class CurvedMirror
extends Mirror
    Virtual Optics

    This class models a curved mirror

    Author:
    Darrin Fong, Tieme Togola
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private double arcAngle
      The angle from the horizontal to the first end point of the arc representing the mirror
      private double arcAngleb
      The angle from the horizontal to the second end point of the arc representing the mirror
      private double arcLength
      The length of the arc representing the curved mirror, specified in degrees
      private boolean convergent
      Tells whether the mirror is convergent (true) or divergent (false).
      private double h
      X coordinate of the circle equation called h by convention
      private double k
      Y coordinate of the circle equation called k by convention
      private int radius
      Radius of the circle equation representing this curved mirror

      • serialVersionUID

        private static final long serialVersionUID
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • radius

        private int radius
        Radius of the circle equation representing this curved mirror

      • h

        private double h
        X coordinate of the circle equation called h by convention

      • k

        private double k
        Y coordinate of the circle equation called k by convention

      • convergent

        private boolean convergent
        Tells whether the mirror is convergent (true) or divergent (false). A convergent mirror has its reflective side towards its center, while a divergent mirror has its reflective side pointing outwards

      • arcAngle

        private double arcAngle
        The angle from the horizontal to the first end point of the arc representing the mirror

      • arcAngleb

        private double arcAngleb
        The angle from the horizontal to the second end point of the arc representing the mirror

      • arcLength

        private double arcLength
        The length of the arc representing the curved mirror, specified in degrees

      • initBounds

        private void initBounds()
        Initializes the bounds of this curved mirror. The bounds are the end points of the arc representing the mirror

      • checkOrientation

        public boolean checkOrientation(java.awt.geom.Point2D.Double source,
                       java.awt.geom.Point2D.Double intersec,
                       LineEq segment)
        Description copied from class: Mirror
        The arguments intersection and segment, are not used here but they are in the subclass
        Overrides:
        checkOrientation in class Mirror
        Parameters:
        source - The source point of the ray segment that hit this optical object
        intersec - The intersection point of the ray segment and this optical object
        segment - The ray segment that hit this optical object
        Returns:
        True if the ray can interact with this side of the optical object, false otherwise
        See Also:
        Mirror.checkOrientation(java.awt.geom.Point2D.Double, java.awt.geom.Point2D.Double, gameComponents.LineEq)

      • closestSol

        private boolean closestSol(java.awt.geom.Point2D.Double source,
                 java.awt.geom.Point2D.Double intersec,
                 LineEq segment)
        Tells if the intersection point of an incident ray with this curved mirror is the closest of two possible solutions
        Parameters:
        source - Source end point of the incident ray segment
        intersec - Intersection point to check
        segment - Incident ray segment
        Returns:
        True if intersec is the closest solution, false otherwise

      • onSurface

        private boolean onSurface(double px,
                double py)
        Checks if a given point is on the curved mirror or not
        Parameters:
        px - X coordinate of the tested point
        py - Y coordinate of the tested point
        Returns:
        True if the tested point is on the surface of the curved mirror, false otherwise
